column4: I have a Gutsy-server box and I'd like to install ubuntu-desktop from my gutsy-desktop CDrom. I'm at the command line. How do I add the CD as a source and pull the appropriate packages from it, rather than from the Internet?
you can't use the Desktop CD as a package source -- only the Alternate CD
I think this is the alternate CD - I downloaded it originally to install on a low-ram machine.
Is there a way to verify whether it's an alternate source?
at the top of /etc/apt/sources.list, there should be a commented sample of how to include a CD repository.
Does the label need to be exact? (the part between [ and ] ) ?
I think so
I've added " deb cdrom:[Ubuntu-Desktop 7.10 _Gutsy Gibbon_ - i386]/ gutsy main restricted "  to my sources.list. Look right?
I don't think so -- not if it's an Alternate CD
Poop.
/cdrom/README.diskdefines has "#define DISKNAME  Ubuntu 7.10 "Gutsy Gibbon" - Release i386" in it .. use that string?
I'm really out of my depth. neil_d might no, or put the question to the channel.
Thanks.
have you seen the section at the bottom of https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FeistyUpgrades ?
see if there is a BIOS setup option to make the PCI card the primary video adapter
There is. This only occurs when I set it to PCI.
Right now I'm using the onboard.
so you've exhausted that?
You mean.. plugging the monitor into the correct one and changing the BIOS?
I would also check if there is still video output from the onboard connector, in spite of setting everything to the NVidia card.
it could well be that your problem is at a lower level
That would have to be an Ubuntu problem then - I believe the BIOS switch turns the device off
